dcterms:description: Compun is a novel benchmark with 400 unique and commonly used compound nouns (CNs) designed to evaluate the effectiveness of vision-language models (VLMs) in interpreting CNs through a text-to-image retrieval task.
dcterms:title: Compun

dcterms:creator: Yuval Pinter
Cassandra L. Jacobs
Max Bittker
dcterms:description: NYTWIT is a dataset of novel words in the New York Times, which includes newly coined compound nouns that challenge language models.
dcterms:title: NYTWIT

dcterms:creator: Beth Levin
Lelia Glass
Dan Jurafsky
dcterms:description: This dataset, mentioned in the context of compound nouns, provides insights into the semantics of noun compounds and their interpretations.
dcterms:title: Dataset by Levin et al. (2019)

dcterms:creator: Inga Lang
Lonneke van der Plas
Malvina Nissim
Albert Gatt
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on the visually grounded interpretation of noun-noun compounds in English, providing a framework for understanding compound nouns.
dcterms:title: Dataset by Lang et al. (2022)

dcterms:creator: OpenAI
dcterms:description: The dataset mentioned in the context of GPT-4 provides insights into the capabilities of the model in interpreting compound nouns.
dcterms:title: Dataset by OpenAI (2023)
